text.p: Bonds gained in line with the European trend ahead of an anxiously awaited decision by the Federal Reserve on whether to increase its discount rate, with most analysts expecting a 25 basis point increase.
A decision was due at around 1915 GMT.
"Bonds discounted a rise of 25 basis points, but nobody knows what the Fed will really do," said one trader.
Traders said that if the Federal Reserve decided to leave rates unchanged, then Portuguese bonds could dip on Wednesday, particularly if the dollar slipped.
But they would lose even more if the Fed opted to raise the rate 50 basis points, they added.
"Amidst this uncertainty, the Portuguese market followed the external trend but remained cautious and illiquid," said one trader.

The escudo ended calm against the mark, ignoring the weaker tone of the Spanish peseta and the Italian lira. The currency was seen trading at between 100.50-100.65 to the mark on Wednesday, in line with its 100.57/60 close on Tuesday.
